theme.title: Compound time of 12/8. 8th note tied to 16th notes
theme.para: The compound time of 12/8 has four parts and each beat is occupied by a dotted quarter note. The accent is on the first one. Ii is a time similar to the 6/8 and 9/8 times but with four beats. The note occupying all the measure is the dotted whole note.
In this lesson a new rhythmic pattern is introduced: the 8th note tied to next beat:

score.music: (Metrica 6 8 NoVisible)(n * n)(n * c l)(n * c g+)(n * c)(n * c g-)(Barra Final))

part.title: Lesson and observe the differences
part.para: Note the differences between the following rhythmic patterns and how the second one is formed when the notes are tied.

score.music: (Metrica 6 8)(n * n)(n * c)(n * c g+)(n * c)(n * c g-)) (c (n * n)(n * c l)(n * c g+)(n * c)(n * c g-)(Barra Final))

part.title: Exercises
part.para: Exercise 1 - Train your ear and practise the introduced rhythmic patterns.
Exercise 2 - Read scores containing the rhythms studied in this lesson.
